channel.title: Anyone in Boston?
channel.description: Shit seems crazy right now. Anyone in the area? I hope you're staying home and safe.

item.title: Anyone in Boston?

item.description:
elevenbravo:

A person is responsible for their own actions and that is it.

But what about divine preordination and the conflict with free will therein?

[color=’#171717’]I should know better than this.

item.title: Anyone in Boston?
item.dc:creator: elevenbravo
item.description:
What I dont understand is why everyone cares so much that they where Muslim. Retarded Christians just go “HA PEACEFUL RELIGION HUH OBAMA WELL DIS PROVE DAT UR A MUSLIM AND ALL MUSLIMS KILL AND EAT BABIES” Everytime a Christian does something horrible they respond with “oh well dem where not rlly christians just crazy people”

I wish people would just stop using someones religion as an explanation of what someone did. A person is responsible for their own actions and that is it.

item.title: Anyone in Boston?
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Pyro:

Burns? I was under the impression that the bombs were mostly designed for shrapnel.

(granted, I’ve not yet actually looked at any of the graphic pictures)

I’m sketchy on details. Today it’s minor wounds from the shrapnel. My family sucks at sharing information, and I don’t have much in the way of contacting those in Boston.

I’d go with the minor shrapnel wounds over burns, I’ve heard the same thing about the bombs.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone in Boston?
item.dc:creator: Chickenprotector
item.description:
Pyro:

Burns? I was under the impression that the bombs were mostly designed for shrapnel.

(granted, I’ve not yet actually looked at any of the graphic pictures)

Depends on the type of bomb you’re dealing with. Incendiaries, such as Napalm, can cause firestorms (and therefore burns).

Really the only thing a bomb is, is just a shitload of air pressure waiting to be set off. Shrapnel is really just the object(s) it obliterates (or knocks out of its way) initially and it turns them into projectiles.

Edit: There’s a shitload of conspiracy theories flying around now… sometimes I hate my fellow country men… fuckin’ stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: Anyone in Boston?
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
Pyro:

Oh. How close was he to where the bombs went off? How bad was his injury?

He was rather close I believe. But the explosion only burned up his right leg and side. He’s already home, so that’s nice. Course, it’s my opinion that whoever is responsible should be turned over to a couple of good ol’ Boston boys. They won’t let the person or people responsible die quickly. They’ll suffer.

Read full topic

Ramirezoid:

No, he’s right.

News media sculpts islam into this big bad terrible monster and that’s why half of the people in the US can’t tell brown people apart and are avid supporters of the “Kill dem fuken towlhead sand niggers” way of thinking.

He was saying that the mainstream media is trending towards ignoring Islam and demonizing Christianity, which is completely false. In general, the only place where I see people hating on Christians is the internet.

item.title: Anyone in Boston?
item.dc:creator: Winged_One
item.description:
blackout:

Depends which media you go to. Most newsmedias nowadays are either so terrified of Islam or are so drenched in political correctness that they will barely mention Islam in the event of a terrorist attack (Example: BBC). Sadly that’s not so true anymore of Christianity, once upon a time maybe so, but today the media will largely jump upon any so-called “Christian’s” terrorist attempts as an opportunity to attack all Christianity.

Stop being silly.

item.title: Anyone in Boston?
item.dc:creator: blackout
item.description:
Kairouseki:

I’m glad they got him alive. He probably doesn’t know everything but hopefully he can at least give us some information on why him and his brother did this. I try not to be prejudiced like this but it did end up being someone who practices Islam (as well as a Chechen). I know that it’s not the whole religion that’s like this but a lot of people are making it difficult to not see the religion as bad.

Just sayin’, you should Judge whether or not a religion is bad/violent based on its teachings, not the actions of its professed followers. Having said that I have heard the case made both ways as to whether or not Islam’s teachings in the Qur’an/Hadith condone violent Jihad. Personally I don’t know enough about Islam to have a justifiable viewpoint on this.

Winged One:

You say that because they (the media) are constantly reminding the public that he is indeed Muslim.

You never heard them include “Christian” in their descriptions of Adam Lanza.

Depends which media you go to. Most newsmedias nowadays are either so terrified of Islam or are so drenched in political correctness that they will barely mention Islam in the event of a terrorist attack (Example: BBC). Sadly that’s not so true anymore of Christianity, once upon a time maybe so, but today the media will largely jump upon any so-called “Christian’s” terrorist attempts as an opportunity to attack all Christianity.

Example:

danielsangeo:

Anders Breivik

While we’re on that note I should also mention that it has since been discovered that Brevik was by his own profession not a Bible-believeing, sincere Christian, he Just wrote in his manifesto that he saw Christianity as an opportunity for the Consolidation of European Cultural and Ethnic Identity.

Khaney:

now imagine the tremendous hate and harassment his family and relatives will get after this whole ordeal, they say he have 2 sisters in New York

This. Another tragic and inevitable byproduct of such events.

Read full topic
